Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain continued to pelt down at the Providence Stadium in Guyana, causing a delay in the match between India and England.
India and England were set to face off in the T20 World Cup semi-final, but the rain forecast caused uncertainty.
England was at risk of being washed out of the tournament if the match was abandoned due to rain.
India would have progressed to the final if the match was abandoned without a result.
The match had a reserve day, but it was not needed as play resumed after a delay.
The rain continued to cause issues, with the outfield still wet and the covers not being removed.
The players were seen taking a peek at the ground, but the match was delayed due to the rain.
The weather forecast predicted rain showers in the morning with thunderstorms developing in the afternoon.
The match was set to start at 8:00 PM IST, but the rain caused a delay.
The Indian team's practice session was impacted by rain on the previous day.
The English team's practice session was also affected by the rain.
Former England captain Michael Vaughan questioned why the entire ground was not covered, given the rain forecast.
The match had a high chance of showers during the morning hours, with precipitation forecasted to be around 4.7 mm.
The visibility was expected to be approximately 6 km, with winds coming from the east at a speed of 7 km/h.
The humidity levels were expected to be quite high, standing at 81%.
